except(*keys)

Returns a new hash without the given keys.

[Source]

   # File vendor/plugins/will_paginate/lib/will_paginate/core_ext.rb, line 6
6:     def except(*keys)
7:       rejected = Set.new(respond_to?(:convert_key) ? keys.map { |key| convert_key(key) } : keys)
8:       reject { |key,| rejected.include?(key) }
9:     end
except!(*keys)

Replaces the hash without only the given keys.

paginate(options_or_page = {}, per_page = nil)

[Source]

    # File vendor/plugins/will_paginate/lib/will_paginate/core_ext.rb, line 38
38:     def paginate(options_or_page = {}, per_page = nil)
39:       if options_or_page.nil? or Fixnum === options_or_page
40:         if defined? WillPaginate::Deprecation
41:           WillPaginate::Deprecation.warn "Array#paginate now conforms to the main, ActiveRecord::Base#paginate API.  You should \\\ncall it with a parameters hash (:page, :per_page).  The old API (numbers as arguments) \\\nhas been deprecated and is going to be unsupported in future versions of will_paginate.\n"
42:         end
43:         page = options_or_page
44:         options = {}
45:       else
46:         options = options_or_page
47:         page = options[:page] || 1
48:         raise ArgumentError, "wrong number of arguments (1 hash or 2 Fixnums expected)" if per_page
49:         per_page = options[:per_page]
50:       end
51: 
52:       WillPaginate::Collection.create(page || 1, per_page || 30, options[:total_entries] || size) do |pager|
53:         pager.replace self[pager.offset, pager.per_page].to_a
54:       end
55:     end
slice(*keys)

Returns a new hash with only the given keys.

[Source]

    # File vendor/plugins/will_paginate/lib/will_paginate/core_ext.rb, line 21
21:     def slice(*keys)
22:       allowed = Set.new(respond_to?(:convert_key) ? keys.map { |key| convert_key(key) } : keys)
23:       reject { |key,| !allowed.include?(key) }
24:     end
